1: <sup>1</sup> Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
2: <sup>2</sup> Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?
3: <sup>3</sup> Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.
4: <sup>4</sup> Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.
5: <sup>5</sup> Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?
6: <sup>6</sup> Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;
7: <sup>7</sup> When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
8: <sup>8</sup> Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?
9: <sup>9</sup> When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,
10: <sup>10</sup> And brake up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,
11: <sup>11</sup> And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?
12: <sup>12</sup> Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the dayspring to know his place;
13: <sup>13</sup> That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?
14: <sup>14</sup> It is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.
15: <sup>15</sup> And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm shall be broken.
16: <sup>16</sup> Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?
17: <sup>17</sup> Have the gates of death been opened unto thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?
18: <sup>18</sup> Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.
19: <sup>19</sup> Where is the way where light dwelleth? and as for darkness, where is the place thereof,
20: <sup>20</sup> That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths to the house thereof?
21: <sup>21</sup> Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born? or because the number of thy days is great?
22: <sup>22</sup> Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,
23: <sup>23</sup> Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?
24: <sup>24</sup> By what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?
25: <sup>25</sup> Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;
26: <sup>26</sup> To cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;
27: <sup>27</sup> To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?
28: <sup>28</sup> Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of dew?
29: <sup>29</sup> Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?
30: <sup>30</sup> The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.
31: <sup>31</sup> Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?
32: <sup>32</sup> Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?
33: <sup>33</sup> Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set the dominion thereof in the earth?
34: <sup>34</sup> Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?
35: <sup>35</sup> Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go and say unto thee, Here we are?
36: <sup>36</sup> Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?
37: <sup>37</sup> Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,
38: <sup>38</sup> When the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?
39: <sup>39</sup> Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,
40: <sup>40</sup> When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?
41: <sup>41</sup> Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of meat.
